dialogue.text: Morning comes before any of us want it to.
But I suppose that’s just how vacations always end.
Even if those vacations happen to last no longer than a day.
We pack our things and head for the bus stop.
It arrives roughly seven minutes later.
Makoto sits next to me once we board.
Miku sits in the row across from us despite how our current bench could easily fit three people.
She doesn’t say much all morning.
The bus drives slightly over the speed limit, making the clouds work mildly harder to keep up with us.
On the way home, I notice the mangled corpse of a tanuki decaying along the side of the road.
No one else notices it.
And if they do, they elect to remain silent instead of pointing out the beautiful yet grotesque concept of life spawning from death.
I focus on the yellowish mound of wriggling larvae on top of the corpse, trying desperately to live and not become the breakfast of a touring bird.
As the bus moves further away, I spot a buzzard.
I accept that death comes for everyone and everything.
Miku winds up getting off the bus several stops before Makoto and me.
I expected Makoto to get off as well, but it appears that one night alone was not enough to clear her mind of the things she’d locked away in it.
She requires, at the very least, one more morning in order to do that.
And with Ami at work and not able to run interference between the two of us, it makes complete sense to invite her over and see what happens next.
I doubt it will be anything exciting.
Today is already off to a bad start.
But I suppose it’s time to see how much worse it is going to get.
I obviously can’t speak for you, but {i}I{/i} had a good time yesterday.
And you managed to make it through the entire night without [molesting] me, so I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t a little impressed.
Does this mean I get an ice pop?
Do you want one?
Obviously. When do I ever {i}not{/i} want one?
Then...how about I tell you a secret?
Why do I feel like this secret isn’t going to be the type of reward I’m looking for?
Because despite our obvious progress, I still feel a shadow lurking somewhere in the background.
And I’m afraid that as soon as I go back to my dorm, the shadow will fuse with you and turn you back into the same guy who gets off on picking on me.
It’s my shadow. It’s already fused with me.
I suppose that’s true. But sometimes, when the light is angled just perfectly, it moves really far away.
And, forgive my inadequacy when it comes to poetry, but I would very much like to be that light this morning.
Is everything okay? You’re acting a little...unusual right now.
Is that genuine concern or do you just feel obligated to say that?
A little of both.
I see.
Everything is okay.
Good. Because-
But only because I force everything to be okay.
Oh.
Is this where the secret comes into play?
This is where the secret comes into play.
Makoto takes a deep breath and closes her eyes for a moment.
If this were a normal morning, she’d be breathing in the scent of french toast or an omelette made with an ungodly amount of meat in it.
But, as I walked out on the girl who would normally make those things in favor of spending time with Makoto yesterday, there is no scent at all.
She breathes in plain air.
It fills her lungs and I watch as her chest expands and contracts.
She remains silent for a moment before confessing something to me.
I’ve been having some pretty strange dreams lately, Sensei.
They come out of nowhere. Sometimes, when I’m not even sleeping.
I've heard this before.
I very rarely make it out of those dreams.
They’re always the kind that end with you on the brink of death. When the moment death comes is the moment that wakes you.
You know the kind of dreams I’m talking about, right?
Of course. That phenomenon of waking up just as you’re about to die in a dream isn’t exactly uncommon.
I know. It’s a direct result of the combination of REM sleep with the flood of adrenaline that comes from being inserted into a stressful or terrifying situation.
But a more interesting phenomenon is when every single journey through REM sleep yields the same exact dream.
It turns something so obviously fake into something that feels just as real as waking up and starting your morning routine.
For me, that routine is brewing a pot of coffee, taking a shower, straightening out my uniform, and then texting my mother to say good morning.
But lately, that routine has started to become weighed down by the excruciatingly dark undertones of myself and a blanket of stars not at all dissimilar from what we saw on the beach last night.
Well, yes. The night sky is dark by nature. I wouldn’t exactly say that’s a dark undertone, though.
By itself, no. But when you start having the same dream over and over and over again, you start having time to analyze different aspects of it.
The dream is not just of the sky itself but of me as I swim through it.
The only issue is, you can’t swim through the sky. And so logic dictates that I would have to be falling.
Or flying, since it’s a dream and logic doesn’t influence dreams.
To say it doesn’t influence them is a bit of a reach, don’t you think?
Pretty much everything we see is tied to logic in one way or another. Things very rarely happen without reason.
And so, as someone who spends far too much time bathing in this aspect of human thought, it’s easy for me to understand what’s happening in those dreams of mine.
Which is?
I’m jumping, idiot.
I’m having recurring dreams about jumping off of something, somewhere.
And I believe that the reason for this is that there has been something dark growing inside of me for a very long time.
My own shadow, I suppose.
Just mine compels me to think about things like jumping out of a moving car on the highway or taking a few extra painkillers just to see what would happen.
That...definitely sounds a little worse than what my apparent shadow makes me do.
Worse, sure. But I’m stronger than you and would never let something like that overtake me the same way you let {i}yours{/i} overtake {i}you{/i}.
No matter how many times I have that dream, I’ll never try to reenact it.
I’m smart. I have a bright future ahead of me. I have a wonderful best friend. And I like to think I’m at least decently attractive.
You’re very attractive, Makoto.
You’re only saying that because you want another ice pop.
Well, yeah. But also because it’s true.
But why spend time thinking about all of those things when, comparatively, your situation isn’t all that bad?
I’ve explained something like that to you in the past, haven’t I?
What was my reasoning back then?
I think it was something like “That's just the way it is.”
Then that’s my reasoning this time, too.
Not everyone has complete control over their emotions the way you do, Sensei.
There are some people out there who would laugh in the face of all that I go through if it happened to them.
But the amount of effort I put into hiding that part of me really only makes me more tired at the end of the day.
Mix that with an onslaught of dreams that feel more like memories of horrible things and you have one unhappy Makoto.
And, it might not always work, but the best medicine for an unhappy Makoto is someone who can constantly remind her that her troubles are nothing but troubles.
And most troubles go away with time.
Dreams, too.
I don’t want to die, Sensei.
And it’s not that I don’t want to die. I don’t want to think about dying. And, at this point, it’s become almost an inevitability.
I’ll never give into something just because of an inevitability, though. So I guess that's one area where I could be considered an idiot.
But the fact that part of me is there at all is just...
Scary.
Not even that.
It’s just...exhausting.
I’m so tired.
Well then wake up, loser.
Oh, would you look at that. I’m perfectly fine, now.
Thank you so much for listening to me, Sensei.
Any time, Makoto.
You know that a big part of why I say things like this to you is because I think you can handle it, right?
Obviously, but even I have limits.
And so I figured coming out and trying to properly explain more about the things I’m feeling to you would help.
The issue with that is that even though I can try to explain those things, I feel like I can’t even come close to properly doing them justice.
All of those dreams and all of those things that I see, even though I {i}know{/i} they’re dreams, still feel like more.
I know I’ve already compared them to memories, but...even that word doesn’t really apply.
But I’m sure that this combined with everything else I’ve forced onto you over the last 24 hours doesn’t exactly allude to my expected stability, does it?
Oh, I’ve already given up on expecting stability from you.
Is that an insult?
More of an evaluation.
You have depression, right?
Probably. Over 10%% of all people are expected to have some sort of mental disorder. It would make sense if that was the reason behind all of this.
That number definitely seems higher than 10%% based on all of the people I find myself associating with on a daily basis.
We really don’t have the most...stable class, do we?
Not even close.
But what I’m saying is that you don’t really need to worry about how you look to me or anyone else.
Like, if you ever want to show up to[school] some time and skip out on doing my work for me, just tell me.
And if I ask to just...{i}always{/i} skip out on your work?
Well that would just be irresponsible if you want me to keep teaching.
Right...that would be completely irresponsible of {i}me...{/i}
There you go. Now you’re starting to get it.
What I’m confused about, though, is that if you don’t expect stability from me...what do you expect?
Because all this time I’ve been citing myself as the cool, calm, collected one.
I expect literally nothing from you.
Well that's just plain rude.
Do you want to sit behind my desk from now on? Will that make you feel better?
Can I?!
Does that...really make you that excited?
Forgive the pun but, depressingly so!
And...since we’re already on the topic of things that would make me feel better...
Could I ask you to...maybe be a little more honest with me from now on?
Honest about what, exactly?
Honest about the things that I already know you’re doing but you’ve yet to come out and admit to.
Okay, fine. {i}I{/i} am the one who has been hiding the various soups.
Why would you do this?
I just had so many of them. It got out of control.
Nothing is truly certain unless you see it with your own eyes or hear it with your own ears.
And even then, there’s the possibility of what you see or hear being an object of delusion.
So nothing is ever certain as a whole.
But there are some things that are a lot easier to accept once they’re out in the open.
So...I won’t say something like “I’ll be happy with just knowing” because that would make me a liar.
But I’d probably be able to fall asleep a little better.
And that would be a...good start.
I already told you I did it. What else you do want to know?
Can I...ask you how many or would that be pushing it?
That would be pushing it.
Accept your victory and move on with whatever solace that was able to provide.
It feels out of place to say it in this context...but thank you.
Thank you for trusting me and thank you for not viewing me as a wicked witch.
And again, thank you for not [molesting] me in the middle of the night.
I realize that was probably the hardest for you out of all of those things.
Is there any chance for a...second reward?
Right now? Seriously?
Ice pop! Ice pop! Ice pop!
...Fine.
{i}Makoto’s affection has increased to [makoto_love]!{/i}
